review:
The fact that I am writing this review on Steam should give you an idea of the dire state this game is in. When Overwatch came out, Blizzard was boasting the millions of players that were playing this game on their own launcher. Since they can attract a large audience on their own, what would be the reason to put this game on Steam. Out of the kindness of their hearts?

It really does pain me to write this review, I have poured the past few years of my life into this game. I've played over 800 hours into this game; now that might not seem like much, but I was going to college, and going on to my first full time job. Between all of that, it's a lot of time to sink into the game. Now I can't even be bothered to play a game that has lost it's soul.

I can go on talking about the balance changes, the matchmaking, and so on. But really, That's been argued to death, even during peak Overwatch 1. The main reason I am here is to vent about what got me to quit playing this game.

It's really simple, Blizzard does not respect you as the player. They only care about the 16 digit code that's in your wallet.

I get that it's a free to play game and they need a revenue stream to keep the lights on, I am fine with that. The first strike for me was when they locked heroes behind a battlepass. Hero swapping was core to the winning strategy for a lot of games. Sure you can grind out the battlepass, but I already have a full time job. As much as Blizzard likes you to think otherwise, this is a pay to win scheme.

The second strike for me was when Blizzard locked me out of playing Overwatch 1, which at the time I spent retail price on. This game, Overwatch 2, was marketed in a way to where you can continue playing the first game if you wanted to, but if you payed for the sequel you'll get bonus content. That was a lie. When they locked us out of Overwatch 1, they knew they goofed on their previous promise, so they decided to give people who bought Overwatch 1 Kiriko. I guess I should be crawling on my hands and knees up to Bobby Kotick's throne, personally thanking him for this bounty they have bestowed upon us.

The third strike for me was the announcement that they had significantly scaled back the PvE mode from what was advertised. To be honest, I really didn't care to begin with, I absolutely adore the PvP multiplayer and had no interest in PvE. This news left a sour taste in my mouth, and solidified the fact that Blizzard does not respect it's players. This sequel was never about the bonus content, but for the shop update. It might've started out different with good intentions, but that's not where we've ended up.

That's when I decided to get of this ride, promising myself to not play this game again (except for this review). I honestly don't know what it would take for them to win me back, but my trust is gone.

I hope this review was helpful if you've made it this far. Myself, and I'm sure others on Steam, are here to vent their frustrations with the direction this game has gone into since it's GOTY days. I'm glad blizzard put this game on Steam since you can't leave a comment on their launcher. 

I implore everyone who is sick of the way blizzard is treating its players like piggy banks, do not play this game, even if you're not buying anything; ignore it. Moving this game to steam is their way of inflating their player count. I think this game has been incredibly mismanaged. and if this is the hill Blizzard is dying on with it's direction, then my hope is for enough people to ignore this game, so that this game can die with dignity, if there is any left.

Itâ€™s a bit bizarre everyone reviewing this has to say something like, â€œI have 1,000 hours of playtimeâ€ because steam doesnâ€™t show playtime. Youâ€™ve got people assuming this game is being review bombed by bots, but read the content of the reviews and itâ€™s literally just angry fans. 

I am one of those people, I played in 2016, I played in the content drought of 2019, and I played the launch of 2. 

They botched it.

Overwatch 2 is a failure. A total disgrace. This is the worst online multiplayer ever just by principle of what it is. A glorified update in every way, shape, and form to a game in an already pitiful state. This game feels like it was in a box that said â€œin case of massive PR nightmare break glassâ€ and thatâ€™s exactly what Blizzard did. You canâ€™t even find a better alternative because Overwatch 1 is dead. The battle pass sucks and the in game shop is  horribly overpriced. Fuck Blizzard. Fuck Activision.
